basics.name: Sierra Morales
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in 2025.

work.summary: Performed independent research in the fields of artificial intelligence and cosmology under mentor.
highlights: Processed and analyzed astronomical image data using advanced methods like image alignment and subtraction.
Generated a simulated dataset by applying PSF interpolation to real Hubble Space Telescope images.
Created and trained a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) to identify supernovae in Hubble Space Telescope images.
Adapted the iDrizzle subtraction technique for use with data from the upcoming Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope.
Presented original research at a student research symposium, demonstrating the completion of a high-impact project.

work.summary: Contributed to CNN used for star detection and annotation for object tracking and space domain awareness.
highlights: Adjusted model architecture by adding more custom convolutional layers to the feature extracter of the base ResNet model, increasing WCS fit rate by 5% while maintaining compact model size.
Evaluated model performance by experimenting with varying numbers of ground truth star annotations.
Surpassed Air Force Space Command accuracy requirements for the Space Surveillance Network, achieving an error rate of less than 1 arcsecond (requirement: <3 arcseconds).
Developed a flexible class to allow different ResNet versions to be passed through configuration files.
Accelerated model analysis time by 10x through codebase optimizations.

work.summary: Effectively managed the cash register, accurately calculated and distributed tips, and ensured smooth daily operations through excellent customer service and efficient order fulfillment.
highlights: Provided friendly and attentive customer service by taking and processing orders.
Maintained a clean and organized work area to adhere to health and safety standards.
Handled transactions and balanced the register at the end of each shift.

awards.title: Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program Indepedent Project Funding
awards.summary: Recieved funding for independent student research project.

references.name: David Rubin (drubin@hawaii.edu), Zach Gazak(jzgazak@gmail.com), Justin Fletcher
